intro: Chamaesyce malaca, commonly known as Malacca spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with simple, alternate leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
